ygData.subject: Announcement: PPSN 2014 Workshop on Nature-inspired Techniques for Robotics
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi neat users, I thought this could be of interest to you... (ie. evolutionary robotics is much welcome in this workshop). Hope to see you there! Cheers,

Hi neat users,

I thought this could be of interest to you... (ie. evolutio=
nary robotics is
much welcome in this workshop).

Hope to see you there!

C=
heers,

Nicolas Bredeche

=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D

The Parallel Problem Solving fro=
m Nature Conference (PPSN 2014) will host
the Workshop on Nature-inspired t=
echniques for robotics (September 13,
2014, Ljubljana, Slovenia).

The purp=
ose of the workshop is to analyze the state-of-art /
state-of-knowledge in =
the field of nature based computation techniques to
automatically design ro=
bot controllers and/or morphology, as well as
learning and optimization of =
real or simulated autonomous robots. We
consider such nature-inspired techn=
iques from the perspective of both
engineering (designing efficient robots =
wrt. a task) and biology
(understanding biological mechanisms using robots)=
.

This workshop aims at bringing together researchers and experts in
diffe=
rent disciplines, fostering interdisciplinary debate between fields
such as=
 neuro-evolution, evolutionary design, artificial life, evolutionary
roboti=
cs, developmental and learning in robotics, adaptive collective
robotic sys=
tems, etc. The workshop is intended as a melting pot for
engineers and rese=
archers working on any of the topics listed above but
also for any other at=
tendant to PPSN who can be interested in the potential
application to robot=
ics of his/her field of expertise.

Topics:
        =E2=80=A2 Collective ad=
aptive systems: swarm, social intelligence, etc.
        =E2=80=A2 Evolutio=
nary robotics: co-evolution, open-ended evolution,
shaping,
        =E2=80=
=A2 Development and learning with robots
        =E2=80=A2 Bio-inspired rob=
otic design: evolvable hardware,
morpho-functional machines, modular roboti=
cs, etc.
        =E2=80=A2 Bio-inspired controller design: artificial neura=
l networks, etc.
        =E2=80=A2 Modelling and simulation with robots: ar=
tificial life,
individual-based modelling, mixed societies, etc.

This half=
-day single-track workshop will feature:
- keynote talks from different res=
earchers in the field: S. Doncieux (UPMC,
France), E. Haasdijk (Free Univer=
sity Amsterdam, the Netherlands), H.
Hamman (University of Paderborn, Germa=
ny), J-B. Mouret (UPMC, France), A.
Prieto (University of A Coru=C3=B1a, Sp=
ain), S. Risi (IT University of
Copenhagen, Denmark)
- research spotlight (=
10 min presentation) from submitted works
- a panel discussion

HOW TO PART=
ICIPATE

We invite authors to submit a 1- or 2-page abstract describing res=
earch or
a review/discussion related to the topics listed above. Summary of=
 already
published research (journals or conferences) as well as sumary of =
research
program are very welcome. Participants with accepted contributions=
 will be
given a 10-minutes slot for presenting their work in a spotlight s=
ession.

Please submit your abstract through e-mail in PDF only at
claudio.=
rossi@... and nicolas.bredeche@...

Important dates:
        =
=E2=80=A2 Submission: May 31st, 2014
        =E2=80=A2 Notification of acce=
ptance: June 6th, 2014
        =E2=80=A2 Workshop:  September 13th, 2014

F=
or more information:
http://www.disam.upm.es/NIR_workshop_2014
http://ppsn2=
014.ijs.si/?show=3Dworkshops
http://ppsn2014.ijs.si

=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D

<div dir=3D"ltr"><div><div>Hi neat users,<br><br></div>I thought this could=

Cheers,<br><br>Nicolas Bredeche<br><div><div><div><br><div class=3D"gm=
ail_quote">=3D-=3D-=3D-=3D<br><br>The Parallel Problem Solving from Nature =
Conference (PPSN 2014) will host the Workshop on Nature-inspired techniques=
 for robotics (September 13, 2014, Ljubljana, Slovenia).<br>


<br>
The pur=
pose of the workshop is to analyze the state-of-art / state-of-knowledge in=
 the field of nature based computation techniques to automatically design r=
obot controllers and/or morphology, as well as learning and optimization of=
 real or simulated autonomous robots. We consider such nature-inspired tech=
niques from the perspective of both engineering (designing efficient robots=
 wrt. a task) and biology (understanding biological mechanisms using robots=
).<br>


<br>
This workshop aims at bringing together researchers and exper=
ts in different disciplines, fostering interdisciplinary debate between fie=
lds such as neuro-evolution, evolutionary design, artificial life, evolutio=
nary robotics, developmental and learning in robotics, adaptive collective =
robotic systems, etc. The workshop is intended as a melting pot for enginee=
rs and researchers working on any of the topics listed above but also for a=
ny other attendant to PPSN who can be interested in the potential applicati=
on to robotics of his/her field of expertise.<br>


<br>
Topics:<br>
=C2=A0=

orpho-functional machines, modular robotics, etc.<br>

, etc.<br>

ith robots: artificial life, individual-based modelling, mixed societies, e=

<br>
This half-day single-track workshop will feature:<br>

e talks from different researchers in the field: S. Doncieux (UPMC, France)=
